ygData.subject: Re: Order of receiving messges on this list (off-topic)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, this is indeed waaay off topic, but I ll reply to the list since understanding our medium of exchange generally doesn t hurt.  If this provokes any
ygData.messageBody:
At 11:16 AM 6/10/99 -1000, Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn wrote:
>I have noticed that frequently I receive the reply to a post before I
>receive the initial post.
...
>I'm a grad student working on my degree in information systems and when I
>can't figure this kind of stuff out it bugs the crap out of me. Thanks
>ahead for anyone who can shed some light.

Yeah, this is indeed waaay off topic, but I'll reply to the list since
understanding our medium of exchange generally doesn't hurt. If this
provokes any further discussion we shouldn't abuse a busy, well-focussed,
well-behaved list.

Email is a lot like real letters. Order of delivery is not constrained and
mail handling software makes no attempt to maintain any order. For
example, a delivery system may run multiple processes and one may stick on
a communication failure or a large message and let another with more recent
messages get ahead.

You can't see it, but down in the bowels of the Internet the "IP" part of
"TCP/IP" works the same way.

Bob
